Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: littlemissmoppet
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here based on the proximity to the MRT station for an easy transfer to and from the airport as we had only one night in Singapore. Overall I think it offers good value for money in an expensive city. The room was adequate with an attached shower room with plenty of hot water. The breakfast was just toast, juice and coffee. The hotel is located on a pedestrian street so we did not hear any traffic noise. we walked to the river in around 30 mins. It was also handy for the hop on hop off bus which was only a few minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money & Convenience in Bugis Area”
Reviews.Author: EnAjOe
Reviews.Content: Hot shower was not working when we checked in but it was fixed promptly after we requested. Room is clean, size of room is alright considering it is in Singapore, I would say value for money as well but don't expect much. It is an old hotel but fairly well-maintained. Location is quite good in Bugis area. From Bugis Junction MRT exit, it's about 5-8mins' walk and we had always stopped by Bugis Street. The Kuanyin temple is just right next door but there were no noise fr the street. 2 choices of breakfast, either vegetarian (continental) or very simple western breakfast which is toast and orange juice. If u r a budget conscious traveller then this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “good location, clean and comfortable and excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: LondonMargot
Reviews.Content: Reception welcoming and informative. Room was spotless as was the bathroom. very comfortable bed and room air-conditioned. Complimentary breakfast is either Asian buffet or Continental. The Asian buffet is delicious and better value. The hotel is quiet and in an excellent location near MRT Bugis. Very helpful staff arranged airport shuttle for me before I left. I will recommend this hotel and definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel room, Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: linda_stwn
Reviews.Content: I stay at South East Asia Hotel with my family for vacation. Enjoy our stay in this hotel because the bedroom is big enough for 3 of us and bathroom very clean, they clean it and change the towel every day. Location of this hotel very good, next to Bugis street and Bugis Junction. Close to MRT station (6 minutes walking to Bugis MRT station) and bus stop so you can go everywhere by bus or MRT. The breakfast menu is good enough to start your day. However if you want to eat outside, there are many food stalls around this hotel. Definitely will stay in South East Asia Hotel for our next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: LoisKwee
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Surrounding neighborhood are great. Rooms are a little bit old but clean and have standard amenities. Breakfast room is very small and choices of meals are very limited, but considering the rate, i feel ok with it. Reservation is easy (you just send email and wait for their reply), and although everything is done manually in this hotel, but they recorded your reservation very well, so need no worry about it. Will stay in this hotel again if visiting spore in a budget trip.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location...”
Reviews.Author: joapi
Reviews.Content: En route to Thailand, once again, we stayed for one night in the SEA hotel. For us that have used this hotel four or five times in the past, SEA has been always the right choice due to its location in Bugis (5 minutes walking from MTR station), one of Singapore's most exciting neighbourhoods. For Singapore standards the hotel's price is fairly cheap, although for the same money you could stay in a 4 stars hotel in Thailand... The rooms are simple but spacious and clean and the breakfast, since you like the Chinese option, is acceptable... In short, you pay what you get and certainly we will stay there on our next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: thmarton
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, 1 minute walk the taxistand and 300-400 m is the Bugis metrostation. The chinese vegetarian breakfast is better choice than the continental breakfast. The room was o.k., just it looks a little bit old. The staff at reception was helpful. It was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Choice”
Reviews.Author: Princess_Kat_1
Reviews.Content: It's our first time as a family to visit Singapore. We were looking for good accommodations but the really good ones are expensive. I came across South East Asia Hotel here in TripAdvisor. They are located in Bugis, where I stayed before when I was traveling solo, so I emailed them. They replied promptly. The location is brilliant - 5mins to Bugis MRT, Bras Basah MRT and several bus stops. It's right in the middle of the city and really close to great shopping and eating locations like Bugis Street and Bugis Junction. Waterloo street is super charming in the day, very colorful. There are many flower stands because of the Chinese and Indian temples. The path is also shaded by trees, allowing for a nice morning walk. Farther down, you'll find the Singapore Art Museum. From there you can go anywhere in the city either by foot or bus or MRT. The interior/lobby is simple and small. The lift can probably fit only 5 people but it's fast. The front desk people were pleasant, and unlike some of the reviews, we didn't meet anyone who was less than friendly. We booked 2 rooms - 1 double and 1 twin. Both rooms were adequate, really clean and spacious enough for 2 people in each room. Both ACs worked fine. There was a TV and a water heater with coffee and tea in each room. The bathrooms were small and basic but very clean. As for the heater, it takes a while to get the prefect temperature, but it becomes easier every time you use it. It was kind of weird, though, that there's no division between the toilet and the shower and that the sink in the double room was outside the bathroom. I also wished they had a hair dryer. The rooms are cleaned EVERYDAY. Everyday, there were fresh, new and clean towels and the beds are always made up, the carpets cleaned. Every night, the bathroom floors are dry and clean, which is a plus for me as I hate wet bathroom floors. Kudos to the staff! The rooms are secure and our things stayed safe inside. The rates include either continental or buffet vegetarian breakfast. We called the veggie breakfast "the magic breakfast" since we noticed that we stayed full until 2pm. It tasted good, too. Great value for your money! You won't regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Carlo_Rey
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife for 3 nights at this place. Rooms were clean, shower with hot and cold was also available. Free tea and coffee also in the room. Breakfast was vegetarian but food was okay. Hotel operates on a cash basis. Front desk staff were helpful and when you send them emails, they respond in a timely manner - unlike other hotels. No wifi but location of this hotel is really good. There's a hawker place nearby and also near to Bugis station.

Reviews.Title: “Best budget option in town”
Reviews.Author: James W
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel with a business feel. The rooms have air con, hot water, comfy beds and tea and coffee making facilities. Decent breakfast and nice location. Stay here, not Waterloo Hostel!

Reviews.Title: “Above average no-frills accomodation with few flaws”
Reviews.Author: Walter P
Reviews.Content: Everything that's great about this hotel has been mentioned already — location is tops on the list being a stone's throw away from a large Hawker center, 2 blocks away from the famed Bugis Junction and just a few walks away from the MRT. The free breakfast also beats the complimentary meals provided by competing shacks. The rooms have a very strange number pattern but are generally clean and well-stocked in amenities with the exception of one room that has a gigantic splotch on its wall reminiscent of a victim by a point blank shotgun blast. Sad to say there is no wi-fi in this place and you will have to stock up on a lot of $1 coins should you wish to use their coin-operated 15-minute (yes, 15 minutes for $1!) kiosks at the lobby. The front desk attendants were typically pleasing — particularly the 20-something girl who works the mid shift who was very accommodating and giving us helpful tips and the middle-aged man on the late night shift who was also nice and answered all of our questions as affably as he can. The worst was the old lady who can be best described as a cross between Miss Minchin and Leona Helmsley with a bad case of PMS and diarrhea — she spoke unintelligible angry English and was just hysterical, aggressive and disrespectful to her guests. I would say that she's the primary reason why our rating for this hotel went down several places. But all in all a great hotel for those who prefer to stay away from hostels and want a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “great for no fuss, budget travellers..”
Reviews.Author: ayianna
Reviews.Content: I totally loved this hotel... first off, I am a frequent traveller to Singapore. Secondly, I am a budget traveller. Although the hotel is aged, it is kept clean and has all the basics that you need. I travelled with my husband and 1 and a half year old baby. The aunties manning the front desk were very kind and doted on my daughter. The breakfast was good the first time but you can grow tired of it, if you stay longer than two days because it doesn't change. Not complaining though as the hotel rate was such a bargain! Besides, right across the hotel is the hawker's center. Food that is cheap is very accessible. It's 2 blocks away from the MRT Bugis Station and yes, it's right smack at the Bugis Area. You go out, you eat, you shop. All other tourist sites are accessible via MRT and at a decent distance away since Bugis is right in the middle of the city center. If you don't expect too much from hotels and view it as just a place to sleep, i highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “budget hotel with good location and good price”
Reviews.Author: chitonicho
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel with my 2 little kids for 3 nights. great locoation and good price. this price included breakfast. we can choose vegetarian fried rice or toast bread with orange juice. the room was clean with attached bathroom and coffee and tea maker. this hotel is near mrt bugis (only 6 minutes walk), albert food centre, shooping area like bugis junction and bugis vilagge. we will stay in this hotel if we come to singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Old, quite dirty but good location”
Reviews.Author: foxyCebu
Reviews.Content: We all know that hotels in Singapore are really expensive. So we were lucky we found this hotel for about S$120 which comes with either buffet Chinese vegetarian dishes or toast, jam and coffee which isn't very filling Good thing McDonalds is just around the corner. But if you want a good coffee and a delicious waffle topped with thick peanut butter, I suggest you go to 7 Eleven and for only S$2. It was sooo good (both the coffee and waffle). The hotel is located near MRT station, Bugis Junction, 7 Eleven, fruit stand and a market where you can find cheap stuff. It is near 2 temples and a museum. This hotel is being run by a family of older people. Although there was one lady who was quite accommodating, I think some of them needs a lesson on customer service. They think that if they talk louder(to the extent of shouting) we can understand what they are talking about. Sometimes they came across as rude, specially in the morning while having breakfast. They should post a message in English stating the process of getting a breakfast. Yes, a process. Since you have to get a colored coupon representing what breakfast you prefer, vegetarian or continental, then give it to a guy in the kitchen. Quiet simple but sign language and nasal blah blah will get us nowhere. We had breakfast there twice and I saw them telling (more like shouting) a few guests the process in exasperation like how can you not understand what I'm saying. . . Our bedroom carpet needs a shampoo not just a good vacuuming. Its really filthy. The room is quite big though considering that it's in Singapore. The elevator is ancient but functional. it was I think their 56 year anniversary on the day we checked in. So the building was that old or older. Bed's comfortable, the toilet is so small but clean with no division or shower curtain so everything gets wet while showering. A dispenser for liquid soap/shampoo. shower curtain. The room is supplied with Coffe/tea electric pot. There's an old 14" tv, aircon temp.cannot be controlled and there's a ceiling fan too. Come check out time, I told the woman that we are checking out. She took our key and checked some papers, then called someone on the phone. I stood in front of her for 15minutes, waiting to be released. Then after 15minutes she asked me if I'm waiting for anything. I told her we we're waiting to be checked out. She said you book through a travel agency, you paid already. So all along I had been standing in front of her waiting for her to say that we can go but not even a nod or a finger pointing at the door, I could have understood that. And she didn't even said Thank you or goodbye. Such a rude person. I would probably not stay in this hotel again. . .

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: 123pinki
Reviews.Content: Excellent location to MRT, shopping especially Bugis village, food places. Included in price is breakfast , continental or Asian vegetarian. We had vegetarian and was nice choice and tasty. It is family business, open basically 24 hours with very nice an helpful people running this place located in walking zone. Taxi stand is just short walking distance down the street. Room was clean and good size for Singapore, with LCD TV, small fridge , cabinets and bathroom with shower and toilet, with room service and clean towels every day. Internet on corridor, WiFi dongle on request and small charge. You really can ask more fro $100. We will definitely stay in this hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: TotaraPakaranga
Reviews.Content: We knew that we would arrive late in the evening to Singapore. So for the price of S$100 double bed per day it was worth it. Very helpful reception service. Local calls charges were very very reasonable. Room was average size, basic double bed and a small TV. Just a average toilet, shower and a small sink. We were very tired after our long flight from Munich. So slept very well. Breadfast was included, but we did not eat there, as there are many foodstalls in the area. Location is great. Near Bugis, Sim Lim. I must say, the people in the reception area, are very helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Untrustable”
Reviews.Author: pinkylurves
Reviews.Content: I've sent emails to make room reservation. I've gotten email confirmation from them that my reservation is CONFIRM and they confirm that I could park my vehicle at a 'private apartment' nearby the hotel at SGD10/day. I was glad that I was able to book a hotel at such a good rate + the location of the hotel is good. Few minutes walk to train station. To my horror, I received a email from the hotel staff A MONTH LATER (and I will be travelling to Singapore next month!), saying that 'parking is not available at the private apartment.' Of course, I was mad because initially they told me that I could park my car at the 'private aparment' (please bear in mind that PARKING IS NOT FREE OF CHARGE) and now they said 'no, the parking is not available.' I cancelled the reservation because they did not keep their promises and I would not take the risk to park my car at the road side.

Reviews.Title: “Central and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: OverseaTripper
Reviews.Content: The South East Asia Hotel was very affordable and breakfast was included. The downside was only that the rooms were small and dark, but clean. The upside was location and with a market right outside the door made for a pleasant walk and easy access to taxis. A two night stay was enough thou.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the middle of all of the action.”
Reviews.Author: SoopsAucklandNZ
Reviews.Content: We were to stay at the beginning and end of our Asian holdiay but the Volcanic ash from Chile knocked off a few days - ended up only staying two nights - but would stay there again. Great location easy to get to anywhere from here. Interesting places around and about and easy to get to public transport or taxis. You need to pay in local currency in advance - either each day or in a lump sum when you arrive - it's OK if you are prepared for this. They say a deposit is required but they may waive it depending where you are coming from. Breakfast included - pretty basic but OK to get you going.- Asian or toast & coffee. You can take a look before you commit yourself to one or the other!!!! We found the staff obliging - no hassles with anything.. Good price - for Singapore!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option in an interesting area”
Reviews.Author: lozzzzie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights last month in a superior room. It had a good view (the pedestrianised part of Waterloo Street) and also had a fridge and a kettle. I arrived very late (4am) and was warmly welcomed. The room was large and had a seating area as well as a wardrobe. As others have said, you cannot adjust the temperature of the air conditioning yourself - however, this was not really a problem. I ended up switching it off the second night as it was too cold and the room stayed at an agreeable temperature until the next morning. Breakfast is nothing special - the Chinese buffet seemed a better option than the alternative of toast and orange juice and filled a space but wasn't particularly tasty. Not a lot of room to sit (I had to share tables both days) unless you go next door into the attached restaurant. However, breakfast staff were smiley and energetic and were quick to clear tables. I chose this hotel because I was looking for a budget option that was clean and in a fairly central location. I didn't want to book a room in a hotel that rents rooms by the hour nor stay somewhere way out from the centre. The hotel is old and could do with a little updating but at this price and in this location (in Bugis, not far away from the MRT with a food court across the road, shops and two interesting temples nearby) it's a bargain. I'd recommend it and hope to stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money..and much more!”
Reviews.Author: Luna_Shin
Reviews.Content: I think it's a matter of setting expectations. If you paid just S$140 for a room good for 4 persons plus free breakfast, I think it's wise to say that you shouldn't expect the Marina Bay Sands...or even Intercon or Peninsula for that matter. South East Asia Hotel is a budget hotel located right at the heart of the pedestrian mall that is Bugis. It is near two temples and right smack in the middle of urban Singapore: there will be noise coming from the flower vendors, the fortune tellers and the many pedestrians who flock on the street to buy either flowers for their deity or beef jerky for home. First, let me state the obvious: South East Asia Hotel is quite an ancient hotel (more than 50 years old) which still manages to provide a good place to sleep and chill when you are not busy pounding Singapore's pavement. The door leading to the reception says it recently celebrated its 55th? or 57th? anniversary and the truth is: it shows. The carpet is quite old, there are few cracks in the bathroom tiles and the furniture is quite outdated, but for S$140: you will be sure that you will have a safe, comfortable environment you can call your "temporary home" at night. In Singapore where everything is expensive, SEA Hotel is heaven sent to those who would like to find a nice, comfortable place to stay minus the prohibitive price tag. The rooms might be old but they are well-maintained, plus the family who runs it are nice and accommodating. Previous reviews here state that 'auntie" (at the reception) is quite rude--but I never felt any rudeness from her. In fact, everyone was so nice and accommodating. I think its just the matter of how the Singaporeans speak that they are mistaken for brash behavior. They are accommodating and kind, and won't even shy away from small talk. The rooms are quite old, but they are well maintained and comfortable. The room assigned to us (3-52) has a big bathroom plus the bed is comfortable for sleeping. They even laid out a few basic toiletries plus coffee and tea for those who want to have coffee whilst in the room. The aircon takes a bit of time to really "cold up" but once it reaches it's temperature, it's comfortable and conducive for sleeping. What I like: * the location: witness commerce, religion and faith in just one street. close enough to Bugis MRT. * the personnel: big props to auntie who checked us in, and the kind uncle manning the night shift * the FREE breakfast--just because i don't have to pay for it. menu can be repetitive though. however, it's a BUFFET breakfast (vegetarian choice) so you can load up before you start going around Singapore What I don't like/can be improved: * The elevator which was old! But it was efficient and fast though--I just don't like being inside old lifts * towels were not changed everyday. * vegetarian menu can be repetitive Over all, I would recommend SEA to my friends--I'd even go back there should I get lucky and have the funds to go back to SG by next year. It's a place where you don't have to pay as much in order to get comfort, safety and value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Family Trip on Budget”
Reviews.Author: ericAKIRA
Reviews.Content: For 'high price' Singapore, this hotel is good option to stay in. Especially, if you are with your family (safe & nothing to worry about prost, etc) and in budget trip. Everything is accessible within walking distance from here. Traditional Market, Supermarket, Shopping Mall, MRT Station, even the famous Bugis Street (merchandise center). This Hotel only accept cash payment, it means you have to pay your room every morning. The room itself is clean, and so the bathroom is. Has a kettle and basic toilet amenities. The TV was old and boring, cause it only had 4 local channel (which were only news ones). The Breakfast was included in the Room rate. You can choose between Vegetarian Chinese Breakfast oR America Bf (Toast & Juice).

Reviews.Title: “Good,convenient budget hotel with vegetarian restaurant”
Reviews.Author: myristica
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this clean and convenient budget hotel on several occasions and will continue to do so whenever i am in Singapore. The Bugis MRT station is not far away (3-4 blocks) and taxis are readily available in surrounding streets. As i am a vegetarian a big bonus is the adjoining good vegetarian restaurant...and there are more vegetarian restaurants in the Fortune Centre which is about a block away (the one on the first floor is great...try their vege lemon chicken). Family rooms are available and you can have a room with or without a small fridge. Recommend with a fridge to cool drinks.... which can be obtained from nearby small convenience shop. Coin operated internet acces is also available. A light breakfast is included in the tariff...this consists of rice and noodles along with dumplings and a cup of tea or instant coffee, or if you prefer toast and tea/coffee. If you want something more varied or substantial then try the food court across the street from the hotel or indulge in a buffet breakfast at the Ibis hotel which is directly behind the SEA Hotel. Payment is by cash only but as payment by the day is accepted then this is not a problem. My only complaint would have to be that there is no separate shower cubicle in the bathroom so that the whole bathroom floor is wet once you've had a shower. On one side of the hotel is The Kwan Im temple and next to that a Krishna temple and in the next block on the other side of the hotel is a shoppig centre were manicure/pedicure and hairdressing can be had for very reasonable prices

Reviews.Title: “Good spot”
Reviews.Author: atomcat
Reviews.Content: I booked via email & received a prompt reply. I also received helpful information re transport from Changi Airport to the Hotel. Stayed in a superior room with ensuite - air-cond, bar fridge, TV, tea/coffee making (complimentary sachets of instant tea & coffee) + soap/shampoo provided. Room overlooked the busy mall, filled with vendors selling flowers/joss sticks for pilgrims visiting the Kwan Yin Temple next door. Accommodation super clean. Cupboards, drawers, desk in room which gave us the opportunity to stash away the backpacks & 'stuff'. Breakfast is included: choice of continental (toast, spread, orange juice) OR vegetarian buffet (fried rice/fried noodles/savoury steamed buns/sweet deep-fried dumplings) + tea/coffee. Free wifi unavailable - internet USB available for hire at $5/hour. Walked to Orchard Road, Little India, Singapore River/Merlion, Bugis Street area in the 1.5 days we were there. Food courts aplenty in vicinity. I would certainly stay here again for the reasonable $110/nt we paid! Note that the tariff has gone up to $120/nt for a superior room...STILL reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “price & location is good. but room & bathroom needs thorough cleaning, scrubbing”
Reviews.Author: chumm
Reviews.Content: the price & location of this hotel is good. i liked that you pass by bugis junction and bugis street everytime from the mrt to the hotel and vice versa. the rooms were small & old but didn't mind 'coz it was cheap. the blanket was so thin it couldn't keep you warm when the aircon gets cold. what turned me off was the molds in the bathroom. it's just so disgusting to look at everytime i used the lavatory. the lady at the desk seemed strict & moody. overall, i just enjoyed it's location. nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience.......”
Reviews.Author: tessyu41
Reviews.Content: Location is ok and price is affordable. But the only hotel ever encountered that does not allowed to re-arrange their twin beds, we have to put it back ourselves the day we check-out. Gosh, are they not ashame to let their guest do that??? The reason why we always sticked together is we had a kid who moves around a lot when sleeping. Maybe it's because dirts are hidden under the beds.....like grapes?? huh?! So annoying to remind us everytime about our remaining balance even though we already paid 2 days for the 3 days stay. Tactless and sarcastic staffs when talking to us. We don't feel the warm welcome. Even let us wait for so long when we arrived. Though a bit early yet we never encounter such hotel to let guests wait so long. Other hotels would kindly fasten up for our convenience and comfort. As we enter their room on the first day, there is a weird smell on it....Well, better luck next time. But i rather not return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Old Sensation”
Reviews.Author: PrawitaCaesaria
Reviews.Content: Me and my parents arrived in SEA Hotel at 00.30 AM. The staff was very helpfull and nice. I booked this hotel by email only two weeks before and I was asking about triple room (SGD 100), unfortunatelly the room was full, so the staff suggested me superior room with extra bed (SGD 130). But as I arrived the staff informed me that there was a triple room left and please me to that room. On my first Impression, our room was not very good. It feel and smell like old, but after I reached the bed and see around, it wasn't that bad. worthed enough for your money plus I could see the beautifull temple outside my window pane. =) Ms. Choo (one of the SEA hotel staff) had a quick response to my email, and always help me find out every answers to my questions. She asked me to call before my plane departed. At first I hear her voice, it sound a bit rude. But after I saw her, I think it just a matter of dialect. This hotel had the best location in town, represent Singapore very well. Open the hotel's door if you went right there's a Kwan Im Temple and Hindi Temple, just went left if you want to feel the atmosphere of local market. well, truly local market people can buy fish or meat for dish. Hawker centre is in the corner, less then 100 steps away from the door. find your favorite food here, mates. Simply accros the street after the hawker centre and you'll arrive at famous Bugis Market. Bugis MRT station is just two blocks after the market, not more than 10 mins walk from the hotel. You can even find some old chinese fortune teller in front of the hotel, or if you loved a cultural sightseeing, kampoong glam is not too far from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: catchr
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel via online and paid it in full. We arrived at the hotel about 9:00 am, 5 hours earlier than the check-in time. The people at the counter were busy, but still they managed to accommodate us and allowed us to leave our luggage. When we came back, they gave us the key to our room without much fuss. We claimed our luggage and went up our room without anyone assisting, as expected. AFter all, it is a budget hotel. The room is is somewhat dated and a bit dark. There's only 1 window, which was partially blocked by the exhaust fans (i think) for the hotel's aircon. But otherwise, it is nice. It has hot and cold shower, which for me is very important. No division between shower and toilet, but still spacious enough. Beddings are a bit worn out but it's ok for me. I was surprised that the hotel provided some toiletries and towels plus some packs of instant beverages and cups and saucers to boot! I thought a hotel this cheap wouldn't provide it. So I really liked the room! The location is great! One of the famous hawkers' center in SG - the Bugis Street, is just walking distance from the hotel. So many places to see here. Great for photo ops. MRT is just a few blocks away. I will definitely choose this hotel again when i come in SG with the whole family.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: EssleyJane
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in a triple room containing three single beds. Easy to find - not too far from Bugis MRT and in a large and well lit street (we arrived at night). Rooms spacious and clean - a bit dated but beds were comfy. Bathroom was fairly large and clean also, shower worked well. Internet was expensive though and you have to pay to get a USB dongle from the reception, and they only have three so if they are all in use you have to wait. Hairdryer was available for hire from reception too. Breakfast was very disappointing - you had the choice of chinese-style or western, we had the western which consisted of a cup of tea/coffee, a small glass of orange juice and two pieces of toast. No variation, but hey, it's free. Staff on reception desk were helpful and responded to emails promptly (prior to stay). Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A place worth your money!!”
Reviews.Author: josefina_edionisio
Reviews.Content: As any typical tourist, planning our trip was taxing since we are on a "budget" trip. God was so good because He helped us enjoy our trip without draining our pockets. SEA booking personnel accommodated our request for reservation (a month and 1/2 earlier ) and waived the required deposit. Since our initial ETD was 2 am, they only required us to call them before we leave the airport to guarantee our reservation. Last minute changes on our arrival date and time was also accommodated and we were also allowed to have an early check in since there are no more guests in our room. The hotel is a simple one but it is very clean and well maintained. Location is excellent for the price. It is near Bugis and mrt / bus stations. Bus station going to Malaysia is also nearby. Foods were ok but it would be better if the "buffet " menu is different everyday. Having same breakfast for 4 days is no longer exciting for a tourist !! Though the location is a busy place during day time, night time is is totally different--- it so quite and peaceful. We always have a good rest after a long day of walking and sight seeing. On the overall, everything was ok .

Reviews.Title: “Located near lively and happening place”
Reviews.Author: guddu70
Reviews.Content: this is a no frill hote.budget type, neat and clean .located very near to the singapore no1 street shopping centre, BUGIS. the MRT is also nearby..can reach anywhere in a short time. Lovely food courts Albert centre is nearby with lot of choice of food. A chinese and Hindu temple are just adjacent to the hotel. SIM lim square- one of the electronics shopping malls is walking distance..u can see the latest electronic gadgets..one of the attender ladies in the reception is a bid rude...B/F gets over very fast by 9 am..no room service..everyday u got 2 pay in cash..when making ISD calls frm room phone using the calling card..always dial 1800 code, else hotel will charge u 10C per call . location of hotel is worth paying to stay here..

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for the Non Fussy”
Reviews.Author: Joey R
Reviews.Content: My plane arrived at Singapore at around 2AM, and I took the Airport Shuttle (Sing$9 per person only!) to take me directly to South East Asia Hotel. After the wait in the airport (just 3 people in the bus, it WAS 3AM already by the time we left the airport, after all), the driver proceeded to take me to the hotel. I recognized the area immediately because I stayed in the Intercontinental Hotel in Bugis on my last trip to this wonderful country, but South East Asia Hotel was situated in a side I was not familiar with. As some reviews here have stated, it is on a pedestrian street, but as I arrived 330AM already at the hotel, it was eerily quiet - and would lull you to think that this was a quiet area - far from it during the day, haha. This is one of the more "chaotic" areas in the day, and as some people in my party were from the USA, they were taken aback at how humid and stifling the weather was (November), although I was acclimatized since I was from the Philippines, which shares the same weather conditions. The man who received me at the hotel was very, very nice - and quite solicitous for someone serving at 330AM. They have their own "accounting system" and it's best that you print out your itenerary with you, especially the hotel arrangements, so that everything is clear (in the days that followed, there was some confusion, since my party arrived in 3 stages and left different times also). SEAHotel does not accept credit cards, so you would need to either do a bank transfer (how we did it) or ask a person you know in Singapore to pay for you. I had to leave the hotel at 6/7AM because I had an exam to take along Beach Road (walkable from Hotel although quite a way off, around 15 to 20 minutes to the exam site). I requested a wake up call because I was afraid I would not wake up in time, and I was given that wake up call. The room is old but the bed was clean and the aircon was cold and can be adjusted temperature wise, something I liked. The shower (as you can see from pictures) was either above or beside the toilet bowl, with no separation, so just leave the door open to dry the bathroom. The water supply was strong and they provided soaps and towels. My breakfast that 1st day was the toast since it was still too early for the vegetarian buffet. I recommend getting the buffet to everyone, as two slices of bread cannot possibly be considered a "good" breakfast by any nutritionist. (Although anti carb fans will be hard pressed to choose either one, since both options are carb FULL, haha.) The radish cake and the faux meat bun were better than expected. Different people manned the reception, but all were very conversant in English. At first glance/meeting, you might think that they were curt/rude, but I think that had more to do with the way they spoke (English in a Chinese way, which some of my companions were led to ask "Are they mad?"). They even had time to smile and give good recommendations and directions. Overall, if all you are after is a decent and clean bed to stay in with a filling breakfast everyday, I would recommend this hotel, especially since the location is primo. Across the hotel (slightly diagonal) was Albert Center, a hawker center. Beside the hotel was a mall (not the Orchard Road variety = not the high end type) but we did get our money changed there and were able to buy some eats for gifts back home from there (preserved candies and the like). It was 3 blocks away from the MRT Bugis station, definitely less than 10 minutes walk. And it was bedside 2 temples. I would caution you from the hotel if you are the frilly, princess type who likes being waited on hand and foot - you won't get a porter to help you get your luggage. But for travelers who like roughing it and charting their own way (instead of a tour group led scenario), this is worth the bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Andalusianeyes
Reviews.Content: Singapore is an expensive city and its not easy to find a good central hotel here. I found SEA after a prolonged internet search and being a solo female traveller I chose it due to its a) female owners and b) good reviews. The hotel has a great location and its surroundings are humming with activity from early morning due to shops all around. The MRT is a few minutes walk which makes it a good place to stay for visiting any tourist attraction. The rooms are clean although the bedding is barely average. The bathroom was clean and supplied with shampoo and soap. There was a tea maker in the room with cups. The bathroom was clean but there was no shower curtain which made the whole floow wet since the shower wasnt exactly installed in a stall. But it was clean which is very important. a vegetarian buffet breakfast is served every morning and the food is quite good. There is also an option of a basic English breakfast of toast butter + jam and orange juice. They also have a coin operated weighing machine on each floor to weigh your luggage before heading for the airport. The ladies who run the place are helpful and they stored my luggage upon arrival since the room wasnt available when I arrived. Its not a luxury hotel but its a clean, decent, centrally located hotel and I would recommend it to budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location And Good Hospitality...”
Reviews.Author: akuasyad
Reviews.Content: If u r looking for a great place to stay in singapore, i would suggest this hotel... a very nice location.. near to Bugis Street n Bugis Junction.. good shopping area.. very easy to looking for Halal foods.. just walking around the area... few minutes walk to MRT station.. The room quite spacious.. just ordinary but comfy bed.. clean bathroom.. electric ketle.. but dont asking much for the view.. nothing to offer... (^_^) if u need any info.. just ask the owner or anybody at the front desk.. they will help u.. p/s : ive left SGD50 under the pillow when check out n they send email to me n willing to help me to send the money to me or just keep it until i go there again.. n im sure that i will.. soon... thanks for the hospitality..

Reviews.Title: “Location was the No.1 Reason”
Reviews.Author: Grace8808
Reviews.Content: I had booked one king size room (room no. 336) and another family room which can sleeps 4 adults (room no.352). I had no problem with the king size room, as room was big, clean, new flat-sreen tv, clean toilet. But for the family room, they had given us a roll-out bed for the 4th person, which comes with thin mattress and pillow. The doublebed had bedbugs which made my families hard to sleep for the first night. We complained the next morning, and they had quickly cleaned and changed the bedsheets. The food was okay and repeated everyday, vegetarian fry rice/mee, pau and carrot kuih. The reason we choose this hotel because it is convenient and near MRT Bugis. There were a lot of stalls selling cheap clothings, fruits, hawker centres, which made us easier to get what we want. It was also easy to get taxi. We will definitely go back to stay at this hotel because it is cheap and there is no where in Singapore you can find a hotel which allow 4 adults to sleep in a room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Nancybe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights coming and going through Singapore. Excellent location only a few minutes walk from Bugis MRT . The hotel is in a pedestrian mall so very quiet Very helpful staff - they held a reservation for us until our late night arrival without requiring a deposit, lent us an umbrella when it was raining , held our luggage all day until our evening flight. Having to pay in cash is a bit of a nuisance. As mentioned by others, the shower is on the wall in the bathroom without any enclosure so the whole bathroom gets wet. The rooms are clean and quite large but 1 of the rooms we had smelt of cigarette smoke. Some of the carpets looked worn. The beds were very comfortable except for the rollout bed. TV and A/C in room plus small fridge in superior rooms. Have to pay for internet computers or go to nearby cheaper internet cafes. The breakfast was not so good - The vegetarian Chinese breakfast was better than the continental breakfast but the food ran out before everyone had eaten and was not replenished, the coffee was undrinkable and the kitchen staff were surly but it is handy to be able to get some food before heading out.

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: mistyManila
Reviews.Content: travelling with 2 little kids isn't easy and being on a budget- it was risky trying on a place that might not be conducive for children but we still booked a superior room with two twin beds for S$110 per night. The room was spacious enough and clean. It comes with a closet and a mini ref. We got a room with a view so that's a plus. The downside is the toilet - no shower curtains, the floor is always wet. Breakfast is free but not very palatable. Location is very very good though, very much near bencoolen st. which has a bus stop, 3 mins walk. Or the MRT, 10 mins walk. Overall the hotel was good and comfortable for me and my family. Just make sure to have Sing $$ all the time as the receptionist requires u to pay cash daily.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located, but internet access is extortionate”
Reviews.Author: suprememoocow
Reviews.Content: Positives: It's very clean and the "superior room" is a good size. It's also very well located. Not so positive: The free breakfast isn't worth writing home about: the continental breakfast is two slices of toast with butter and jam, cheap instant coffee (nescafe would have been better, and I hate nescafe!) and a small glass of orange juice. Maybe give the "local breakfast" a go. We found the staff to be a little bit surly, although to be fair they were helpful. Internet access costs S$5 per hour in your room, or S$1 for 15 minutes on the desktop computers in the hallway. Considering Singapore has free wifi citywide, this is a bit rich. If you're not bothered with internet access, it's probably not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cel_the_explorer
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at SEAHotel and it was worth the money I paid for. Being a budget hotel I didn't expect much so I was pleasantly suprised to find amenities such as 2 towels, shampoo, soap, and electronic kettle. The location is excellent too. It's a 3 minute walk to Bugis Street (shopping center) and 5 minutes (or less if not crowded) to the Bugis MRT. I was able to sleep well also and didn't hear any noise from other hotel guests. Another thing I liked about SEAHotel is that they kept my luggage for 8hours without extra charge! The downside about SEAHotel is that some of the staff are not warm and welcoming and the complimentary breakfast could have been better. 4 pieces of burnt toast, 1/2 cup of OJ, coffee, jam & batter won't really last until lunchtime. It could also use a little upgrading since there were stains on the carpet & towels and the bed covers looked outdated. All in all though, I highly recommend SEAHotel if you're on a no frills travel and all you need is a place to crash and clean up.

Reviews.Title: “A surprisingly hectic hotel in the centre of Little India”
Reviews.Author: MarietFemme
Reviews.Content: It was only when we got out of the taxi that we realised the hotel is situated in the middle of a pedestrianised area next to a Hindu temple and a Chinese temple! The doorway to the hotel is under a covered walkway, so be prepared to look for it. Inside I wasn't holding much hope as the foyer was quite small and there was only one lady on reception. She was rushed off her feet with other people and the phone ringing. Having said that, I was amused and surprised that when she welcomed us she was very business like and you didn't feel rushed at all. One of our rooms wasn't ready so she checked first and then checked me in to a different room (twin instead of double) which wasn't an issue as it was only me anyway. Beware that the hotel doesn't have all the modern amenities you might be used to. THere is no printing avaiable from the internet computer (on the third floor), bookings were made via email not an oline bookign form (though it was very efficient) and most importantly, they do not take card. So make sure you have enough cash or can get enough cash to pay! Payment for the rooms is done on a daily basis and a standard room will cost you SIN$100 a night. We were on the first floor. Each room had a fridge and air con as well as a ceiling fan. There were also chairs to sit on and a desk with a mirror. The bathrooms were wet rooms with the showers just open to the rest of the bathroom which wasn't a problem in my room as it dried out overnight but with two people usign the shoer it struggled to dry out properly by morning. A TV was provided in each room with access to CNN and a few other main channels. Shampoo and soap was provided along with 3-in-1 tea and coffee satchets. The beds were comfy and the fan could be turned off though the air con could not and could be heard as per usual. You can also call between rooms easily by typing the floor number followed by the two digit room number. Useful if you have a split group. Breakfast is served quite late from 8:30am to 10am. You have a choice of continental (toast and jam with Orange juice) or vegetarian chinese buffet (noodles, rice, pastries, steamed buns). Each comes with tea or coffee. Unfortunately we only had this on the second morning as we had an early start the first morning for a city tour. Rather helpfully though they did do us the continental breakfast at the earlier time of 7:45am. Check out was easy as everything had been paid for daily and bags could be left in the cafe area if you were travelling later in the day. The taxi rank is right next to the pedestrianised bit so while you can't call a taxi from the hotel, it's probably faster to go out and get one! The closest MRT station is Bugis Stn which is about 10 minutes walk away. It is well situated for visits into Little India and the nearby area. The restaurant is entirely vegetarian. Generally, a nice hotel with hectic but good service!

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: faa05
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnite for transit, paid $100 + $30 coz of F1. tidy room, nice ppl at reception but A/C wasnt cold enough, noisy, room smells old. surely not worth $130.00. i'd rather stay in the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: Alfisti33
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the S.E.A Hotel for about 10 nights. Price including breakfast (continental or local vegetarian) Location very near all attractions, like ´Little India', "Arab Street", Hadj Lane, Bugis Junction, Raffles, Chijmes, Singapore flyer, MRT, Suntec Towers Fountain, busses to Malaysia (Queens Street or Lavender Street) Food center directly across the street, two temples nearby. Kind staff, Internet for 1S$D per 15min, Bathroom including "open" shower. Ask for room with window, if you stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills hotel in Downtown Singapore”
Reviews.Author: LavanderiaChina
Reviews.Content: As usual , let's make it short : Pros: -Excellent Location -Very affordable -Nice Staff -Right next to Budhist Temple! Cons: - Toilet is very small (Shower area is small) -Noisy during the day, but hey, you are in the heart of Bugis Street, near malls temples and good food court. -The breakfast is lame, just Yellow Lipton tea with one piece of toast! Tip: Look for supercheap and great food in the Hawker centre in front of the hotel. Or check for more upscale restaurants in Bugis Junction mall, two blocks away!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence_Hamilton
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 12 nights in September 2009. Reservation was simply and straight forward, just simply emailed the hotel with my requirements which they confirmed within a couple of hours. I stayed in a Superior room overlooking the street for SGD100 per night, which is quite reasonable. The room was a good size and spotlessly clean, although the air con was positioned above the window, which meant standing on a chair to adjust it! The TV was also positioned a bit too high on the wall, but this was not a major concern. The staff were very friendly and helpful, although some of the staff serving breakfast were a bit abrupt and seemed at times not to be in a good mood. But the breakfast, which is included in the price, was excellent and it is also worth visiting the adjacent restaurant as the food there is also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good value. It really depends on your expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Floraltan
Reviews.Content: These points are for the superior room we were upgraded to from a standard room since we were staying for 5 nights. Had to get a good budget hotel since we were staying so long. The good: 1. Clean 2. Fresh, clean smelling, pillows, bedsheets and towels 3. Reasonably big room 4. Very cold aircon 5. Very near to Bugis Street (S$10 clothes!) and Bugis Junction/Bugis MRT 6. Window that overlooks pedestrian street 7. Free breakfast which my daughter and I found quite tasty 8. Good, strong, hot shower 9. Nice people at the reception 10. Westerners might appreciate the culture as there is a Budhlist and Hindu temple next door! 11. Only s$100. If anyone has tried one with a better value, please let me know! 12. Area and hotel suitable for family. Wasn't willing to try out the Hotel 81s and Fragrance chains as I was not sure about the clientele there. The not so good: 1. Aircon is a window unit installed so high up you have to climb on a chair to adjust and turn on/off 2. No blackout curtains 3. Sellers on the pedestrian street can be noisy as they call out to potential buyers for their flowers and other things for the nearby temples 4. You carry your own bags so use a trolley bag as you'll have to drag it a short distance to the taxi stand 5. Only cash accepted and you have to pay every evening (if you decide not to pay at one go at the start) 6. Abrupt, scowling people at the breakfast/restaurant area (but we were prepared for this after reading the previous reviews. LOL) 7. No free WIFI. Have to pay for Internet access (we didnt bother.) 8. Really homely (don't expect any luxuries!) 9. No shower stall. Water splashes all over the bathroom floor.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: tripword
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Singapore, it was a bit of a stab in the dark as to where to stay. I think I found this place in a travel book. We didn't mind it being in a pedestrian-only street as we were walking and getting the train everywhere anyway. It's close to the art gallery (which is really good), and Raffles. The breakfast was good - European as well as some Singapore fare - though it didn't really seem the most healthy I've ever eaten. The room was pretty basic and small, but we weren't hanging out - just going back to sleep. It was quite dark and the one window was high up the wall so no view. Not that there was one anyway - our room looked out to a small lane and a building. The bathroom had an open shower, which I didn't like at all, especially for a hotel and paying $100 Singapore per night. (See the pic.) It was just a shower head on the wall, right next to the bathroom door. So you had to stand next to the door to get under the shower, and the water went everywhere, including all over the door. We had to use one of the towels across the bottom of the door so the water didn't go into the room. It was very clean, and cleaned very nicely every day, including towels and soap replaced. The linen and towels were nice too. Not so keen on having to pay every day for the room, and in cash. And the internet took forever. It used up all the money we'd put in just waiting for 2 websites to load.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again!”
Reviews.Author: port80
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on recommendations from a forum I frequent. I have stayed in other hotels in Singapore before but since we were on a budget (traveling to 5 countries in Asia) for this trip, I figured it would be worth the risk. The booking itself was convenient and hassle-free. I just emailed the hotel, booked our stay, and they replied with all the necessary instructions and information. On the day of our arrival, the cab driver was not instantly familiar with the hotel. We had to give the instructions they emailed, including descriptions of the nearby temple. There's also some 30-meter walk towards the entrance of the hotel from the street and no one will help you with your luggages as usually there's only 1 person in the reception and it is not visible at all from the street. We arrived at around 7:30AM and were told that "usually check-in is at 2PM but fortunately for you, we have a room ready" (yes we are thankful but the way he said it was like he was letting us stay in the hotel for free). Upon handing our room key, we were immediately asked for payment for the 1st night and when we told him we still have to change our money, we were asked for both our passports. They were returned as soon as we paid the $100 for our room that day. No one escorted us to our room and when we saw our room, we knew we were in for a disappointing stay. It was the smallest room by far that I have stayed in and it stank of stale cigarette smoke. These were the only amenities: a TV with 8 stations, the bed, a bedside table, a desk, a cabinet with mismatched hangers and a clothes rack for airing. If the room was disappointing, the bath even more so. It is the first time ever that I have seen a shower head right behind the door such that when you shower, the water is all over the door and the floor. You have to be very careful when taking a shower as the floor tiles are slippery because there is no bath mat or even a divider on the floor -- you basically just use up the entire CUBICLE when showering. Since we were so tired from our long flight from Australia and not wanting to have another semi-hostile encounter with reception, we did not ask for a change of room thinking that the terrible smell of smoke would go away after a while. No chance of that -- we stayed 3 nights in the same room and our clothes stank for several days after leaving Singapore. (It's hard to explain why we didn't move but our days were so jampacked, we would go back to the hotel at 3 or 4am and it was just such a hassle to transfer everything to another room). Breakfast is served from 8:30-10:30AM. You have 2 choices: American (which is 2 whole slices of toast cut into 4, a packet of butter and a packet of jam plus orange juice and coffee/tea) or Vegetarian buffet (dimsum, noodles, fried rice and some taro puff plus coffee/tea, no chance of swapping with juice!). Upon the recommendation of the old Chinese lady at the reception, we had the Veg. buffet. It was so-so but filling enough. The second day, we went down for breakfast at 10:25AM having had a long night and was met with a scowl from the old Chinese lady (you have to get your coupons daily from reception) who reprimanded us that next time, we shouldn't be so late for breakfast! Duh!!!! As it turns out, the dining area was already spotless when we got in meaning they closed breakfast waaaay earlier than 10:30. The guy in the kitchen grudgingly served us toast and coffee with both of them grumbling in Chinese the entire time. We finished our toast so fast just to get out of there and what do you know, the guy took away our plates while we were still finishing our coffee! So rude! Another thing to complain about is that there is no wi-fi in the hotel -- not a problem except that to have internet in your room, you have to pay AND leave your passport which they will only return when you give back the modem. I have no problem paying for services, after all this is a low-budget hotel but this attitude of complete distrust is simply annoying. Others have said that it is probably cultural and maybe because SEA Hotel is a family-run business but I have stayed in other places in Singapore and other family-run hotels in other countries but have never, never been treated the same way. Needless to say, we are not staying ever again in this hotel. YWCA Fort Canning Lodge where I have stayed 2x before may be 10-20% more expensive but it is so worth the premium over this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just to spend the night”
Reviews.Author: Doctorneel
Reviews.Content: Like i said, just to spend the night. Rooms are small, two beds, ok bath. a small tv high up on the wall. No refridgerator. The room overlooks a wall. Non existant room service. You have to carry your own bags. The road is some distance away. Cars stop about 200m from the hotel and you will have to haul your bags to the hotel. Avoid if you have lots of luggage. Breakfast is toast and jam and butter and coffee. But cheap for singapore. Location is good. Right in a market place with plenty of shopping around. And some average restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “very good n budget hotel for family stay esp chinese”
Reviews.Author: yunBrunei
Reviews.Content: i stay first night in deluxe room,it a bit dirty,but next day i change to triple room only cause 140(plus 1 extra bed),for the budget price is considered enough big,n the location in bencoolen,it very convenience for me to shop,n around is tasty chinese food,.n the price is cheap

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: PerthLovetotravel
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit and always stay budget. My requirements are clean, good working air con and breakfast. I got this with SEA hotel. When we checked in at 4am in the morning, I opened the door of the room and went "hhmm".Our view was a wall....but the upside of that was no noise so we stayed with it. The room also had a bit of a smell....but as soon as the air con went on each time, it vanished. (ours was superior room 356, 358 had no smell) and carpet was flat and dull.But after a sleep and a shower i was quite happy and very comfortable. Rooms at front (334) and opposite (346) had views. They have no problems changing rooms though if you press it as one of our group was on another floor and wanted to be near us so they moved her when we saw a vacant room. Rooms were cleaned very well every day. The phone worked, the tv worked and so did the kettle...which was a nice extra as the budgets often don't give a kettle tea/coffee. I decided to handwash my clothing as the laundry price was expensive....so they happily gave me a drying rack and under the fan, it dried well. They also gave an iron and ironing board. When I bought flowers, they happily gave me a vase. You had a fan and an air con and at night you certainly didn't need both. Plenty of cupboard and drawer and wardrobe space. A friend who was staying at a 5 * came in and said wow, this is very spacious.. her daughter liked the cultural aspect of the hotel....which you don't get with a 5 *. Breakfast...yes it was basic, but in fairness the big hotels don't give anything. My daughter had the continental ( 2 toast, jam, juice and coffee) and I had vegetarian buffet (noodles, fried rice, fried carrot cake etc, coffee) and we went halves so each had both on the plate ( 1 toast half the rice etc). Quite a substancial breakkie. There was only one staff member that was a bit rude...and she was on at brekkie. No problems, just ignore. One older lady in reception was also a little abrupt at times but I just chatted to her and she was fine. When there was late excessive noise from one room, I made a call and security came straight up. We loved the area. They happily gave directions to anywhere. Yes we had to hand our keys in when we went out....but they always rememberd who we were and gave keys without us asking. it also is something I practice anyway so that i don't loose the key. I have to say that my only complaint was that there was no pool.....so we went to the local pools. I would stay at SEA again.

Reviews.Title: “get what you pay for; location is the plus point”
Reviews.Author: detoxed
Reviews.Content: Strangely for Singapore, the technological age seems to have bypassed this hotel. No such thing as computerised records and payments are cash only. Rooms are hostel-like and dark with variable air conditioning. However, the beds are clean and the bathrooms and showers acceptable. Breakfast was not worth getting out of bed for - either two slices of toast and instant coffee or grey Chinese dumplings. The advantage of the hotel is its price compared to most Singapore establishments and its location in Bugis not too far from the MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: mrsglory
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for our family of 5 after reading lots of good reviews here on Trip Advisor praising the location and the value for the money of this hotel. The first night, after our air conditioner had been on for about 3-4 hours it iced over and stopped working. By this time our three young children were asleep and it was late. We mentioned it to the staff the next morning but the 2nd night we had the same problem. We had to miserably hot nights of sleep. Because you pay for the room prior to the night rather than at check out, you really have no bargaining tool for the bad experience since they already have your money. They gave us some excuse about how we should have called them in the middle of the night to come work on the AC but did not seem to care that we had young kids we didn't want to wake up nor that we slept terribly for lack of AC in one of the hottest times of year in Singapore. The young man at the desk said the owner would email us after we left but as we suspected, we have heard nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed opinion...”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Girl149
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel over Christmas 2008. I was really looking forward to staying there after reading all of the reviews. Overall, I did enjoy my stay there and would certainly recommend it to anyone who was looking for a nice, clean hotel in a good location. These are just a few of my thoughts on my stay. Positives: It really is in a great location. We walked to Bugis Village, Mustafa, Raffles, Orchard Road, the Flyer, Fort Canning and Chinatown from the Hotel. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. I really enjoyed the buffet breakfast. SOME of the staff were really friendly and helpful. Considering the price of hotels is Singapore, this was really well priced. Negatives: you need to give them your key whenever you leave the hotel, this was not a problem when leaving (you just put it into a slot); however, it did get annoying when it was busy at reception and you had to wait in a queue to get the key back again. The woman who took the vouchers for breakfast and got the coffee was very rude and made things a bit difficult. They also only accept cash which I thought was a bit strange. I would recommend this hotel to others due to the cleanliness, price and location. However, I am not sure if I would stay there again, there are so many hotels in good locations I would prefer somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Family run and personal in nice area. Older hotel for basic 1 night stay.”
Reviews.Author: Spahkee
Reviews.Content: As a result of having a stop over in Singapore both on our way to and out of other locations that we were traveling to, we stayed in the South East Asia Hotel for 1 of our stays and the Hotel Bencoolen (see my review of that property) for the other stay. Both hotels are in the same vicinity. The South East Asia Hotel is closer to the MRT and the Bugis shopping area. However, we found that in spite of excellent directions that the South East Asia hotel emailed us, our taxi dropped us off on Bencoolen Street and since this hotel is on a pedestrian walkway, it was a bit of a walk with two large bags in the rain. We found that the service at the South East Asia hotel to be its biggest selling point. Very personable and welcoming. We asked for a taxi to come for us at 3:15 am and the lady at the front desk actually told us that we could get another 30 minutes of sleep and have it come at 3:45am with amble time to get to the airport and she would take care of ordering it for us. and all with a smile! The hotel is actually quite a bit larger than the small entrance would lead you to believe. The rooms are clean with no funny smells that come from the damp humid air - which is a nice reflection of the daily housekeeping that occurs. Beds were comfortable. However, the rooms are definitely "vintage" circa 1970s hotel type looking. If you can look past that, there's nothing wrong with the sleeping area. We had a good laugh in the bathroom. Walk in and there's no bath tub nor a shower stall, then you turn around and look behind you and there is a shower wand that is part of the bathroom. So, taking a shower in the morning? the entire bathroom is now your shower stall! All in all, it wasn't a terrible experience. But it wasn't a great experience that would draw me to come back to this property. Loved the service and friendly atmosphere. Given that these two property room rates were within USD5 per night of each other we would likely go back to the Bencoolen Hotel over the South East Asia hotel as the rooms appeared to be slightly newer and more comfortable. However, to each his own. If the Hotel Bencoolen was oversold or were significantly more expensive, I wouldn't not stay here given the location and nice people who run the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap cheerful but pongy”
Reviews.Author: wharton1Trencin
Reviews.Content: The south east asia hotel is exactly what other reviews say it is. Its central, cheap, basic and clean. Overall good value for money. The only issue we had (we stayed on the 4th floor) was the terrible smell of the rooms if the aircon isnt turned on (which turns off automatically when you take the key from the slot). Ourselves and our friends had 2 rooms and both stank, becasue we had a late flight we then booked a single third room to freshen up later in the evening after a day out, this was also on the fourth floor and also stank of mould or dodgy pipe work. So if you want good value in Singapore stay here, you get what you pay for, but be warned, the fourth floor rooms stink.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at a great rate”
Reviews.Author: NY11373
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Southeast Asian for 2 nights. This hotel is a little gem in the heart of Singapore, where other hotels may cost 3X as much. It is a small family run business that seem to care about the customer. The room was a rather nice size. It was very clean and well maintained. Had a little nostalgic sense with high cielings. Cons include a small TV mounted on the wall and no shower curtain in the bathroom, A free breakfast consists of toast or Chinese vegetarian. If that is not your cup of tea, a McDonalds is a few minute walk. The area is quite interesting with a Chinese temple and other Buddhist related shops. The area in front of the hotel is a pedestrian way. so you need to walk a couple of minutes to find a taxi. Another con is you need to pay cash. they do not accept credit cards. But the pros outnumber the cond and plan to stay at the Southeast Asian on my next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YorkFoodie
Reviews.Content: If all you're looking for is somewhere inexpensive, clean and centrally located to lay your head after living it up in Singapore, you can't go past the South East Asia Hotel. By Singapore standards it seemed bargain basement for what we were getting. The room was small and a little worn but clean. The bathroom had one of those showers that wets everything in the room, so plan accordingly. We didn't realise you needed to ask for a "deluxe" room to get a refrigerator so no fridge. We didn't need to send a deposit (but were asked to confirm the night before our arrival, which we did), and they did require payment in advance on our arrival. We could have paid day-by-day but opted to just pay the lot in one hit. Breakfast was included but was eminently missable. There's a nice cheap and cheerful cafe at the end of the mall where you can get a much better breakfast for a song. The hotel is well located and in walking distance (if you don't mind a bit of a walk) of Little India, the Raffles and environs, various museums and galleries, and Orchard Rd. It's actually near one end of a pedestrian mall so your taxi can't just drive up, you have to get out in the alley behind or at the taxi stand at the other end of the mall, but as long as your baggage is manageable it's not that big a deal. Staff were a bit offhand but not unfriendly. It's quite a large place so I guess it's hard to develop a rapport with the guests. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hostel style accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Gel36
Reviews.Content: Singapore is expensive so we chose a hostel style hotel. This hotel is run by a couple of very efficient and friendly ladies. Booked in by email and they didnt even insist on a deposit. You pay each day as you go - keeps it simple. Situated right in Chinatown you are right in the action and Bugis tube station is 5 mins away. The rooms are small but perfectly adequate. There is some building noise at the rear, so choose a room at the front - they are the only ones with a view. Breakfast was basic but there are plenty of restuarants nearby so no probs.

Reviews.Title: “Just for Budget Traveller...”
Reviews.Author: Saranghae
Reviews.Content: The lobby is very small and the elevator is also very small and seems very old and need to be repair. The room size is moderate but very old and need to be refurbish. The aircon is old and very noisy...the bathroom is small and very slippery. The advantage of this hotel is only its location...at Bugis area...very near to the shopping mall and MRT station. This hotel rates is quite expensive...because I think with SGD100/room/night I get much much better hotel in Malaysia for example...but this is Singapore...a very expensive city...but also very enjoyable city.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay”
Reviews.Author: Bristolians
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1.30pm and our room wasn't ready which was an inconvenience as we had been on a train from Malaysia for about 15 hours. However we were able to leave our bag there (we had cable locks with us which were handy) The rooms were okay, especially after being in Thailand and Malaysia. The hotel seemed good value compared to others in Singapore. Breakfast was rice/noodles etc but luckily the waitress offered us toast and tea. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, and very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: aries_traveler888
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the SEA Hotel for the first time in 2007. At first i felt a little strange, because the hotel ask (not require) that you leave the room key with the front desk when you go out. But beside that, the staff is friendly, the room are clean, the location is great, breakfast was adequate for an asian pallate (vegetarian), but the few westerner that I met during my stay didn't have any complaints either (maybe the one I met are the adventourus one, palllete wise). Non-existant businness facility, but for leisure in Singapore hard to beat the price. Some of the rooms have a Window A/C (old model) and were a bit loud, but if you spent the day walking around Singapore, it didn't bother me much. There's a great laksa stall just around the corner of the hotel, and across is good selection of hawker fare. Anyway all in all the SEA hotel is a good value for money in Singapore. Will be coming back to SEA Hotel this Sept. Hope it hasn't change for the worse :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Middle of Bugis.”
Reviews.Author: JayVG
Reviews.Content: My friends and I caught the tail end of the Great Singapore Sale and wanted a no-frills hotel that's near the MRT. The hotel is around 2 streets away from the Bugis MRT station. The rooms are ok, after all we left first thing in the morning and came back late at night. And I remember this print ad that showed all black space with the copy, "When you're asleep, all hotels look like this." Anyways if you'd rather spend on clothes and food and want to save on your hotel, SEA hotel is it. Aside from the MRT station, you can also walk to Sim Lim square (although I don't recommend buying electronics there. I had a great experience at Best Denki, Vivo City, but I digress...), Singapore Art Museum and Bugis night market. Hawker centers surround the hotel so eating won't be a problem. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great for shopping!”
Reviews.Author: jasmanyee
Reviews.Content: Great hotel which was recommended to me by New 7th Storey Hotel (where I originally tried to book two rooms). Booked two superior rooms which came with bathroom (water not always hot but OK since S'pore is soooo humid), large cupboards, queen size bed, tv with remote, dresser, fridge, and shampoo/soap. Always some activity outside due to being right next to the famous Kuan Im Temple, and one-minute walk to the Bugis St Markets. Close to Little India, Arab St, lots and lots of shops. Rooms are spacious, clean and comfy (with air conditioner and ceiling fan), and the linen gets changed every day. If you are a westerner you will have to make sure you ASK for the continental breakfast, which is just toast and jam and orange juice, otherwise the breakfast is primarily catered for Asian taste e.g. steamed buns, fried rice, fried noodles.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Good”
Reviews.Author: iluvtoshop
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite good.. Strategic location.. The bus stop is few steps away.. The rooms are clean and they also provide hot water all day.. But the tv didn't have any good channel. You'll get bored in the room.. The bus stop is few steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations!”
Reviews.Author: EfJay
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean, convenient flophouse with decent extras like generous breakfast (particularly the Chinese courses) & tea making facilities at a very moderate price ($100S all up). Staff friendly and helpful - provided map/advice on getting out of town on public transport after holding our reservation for one night (made by email without a deposit, even though we arrived on a late night flight). The number at breakfast indicative of a popular place - a range of business and tourist guests of all ages from all corners of the globe. Necessitated sharing tables but it added to a happy atmosphere & was a fun start to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: lovestraveling53
Reviews.Content: I was meeting my husband the next day in Singapore, so I was concerned about arriving very late at night by myself. After the taxi cab driver finally found the hotel ( I had printed out a map & directions), I checked right in & was in my room promptly. I had to call the front desk because I did not know how to get the A/C to work, but he sent someone up immediately. I had booked a superior room. The room is older & plain & simple furniture, but nice and large and mine was very clean. As my checked luggage was lost, it was nice to find a small bar of soap & shampoo provided. I had been forewarned by a fellow T.A. reader that the coffee in the room had cream & sugar already added and that I could ask for toast & coffee for breakfast, if I didn't want the Asian breakfast. This was adequate. I found the front desk help, very nice and helpful. They called the airport for me to check on my lost luggage. It was very convenient to Bugis metro stop and we loved being in the middle of all the activity. We only stayed there 2 nights and then moved to a different hotel further out, which was newer but not as big and clean as the South East Asia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - good location”
Reviews.Author: AndyBKK
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel. Rooms were comfortable and clean. You can't expect luxury for SI$100 but this was fine, and a nice vegetarian breakfast included in the price. 2 internet PCs on each floor for SI$1 for 15 minutes. TV was small, and no remote. No fridge in the room. But no problems. The location is great; plenty of shopping and market stalls on your doorstep. Interesting temple next door and no traffic as it's on a pedestrian zone. They don't take credit cards - just cash.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location and very good price”
Reviews.Author: FisherTours
Reviews.Content: The South East Asia Hotel is a great little hotel in the centre of Singapore. Very convenient to get around and close to the Bugis subway stop. It's a basic hotel, but clean and very reasonably priced compared to other places in the city. I would definitely recommend it for people travelling on a budget and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: huyla
Reviews.Content: I came back to Singapore in one of the peak seasons there, that is Lunar New Year festival. Therefore, all the hotels seemed to increase their room rates. It was truly hard for a budget traveler as me to find a good hotel within 100 SGD per night. I had to call my friends for advice, and they were really helpful as they guided me to South East Asia hotel located near the biggest shopping street in Singapore. The hotel charged me 90 SGD for a night. The room facilities are quite good and enough. The bathroom is rather spacious. The only problem is that there was no mini-bar inside the room. When I asked about that, the very friendly staffs told me that just only superior room has mini-bar, and the rate for a superior room is 100 SGD per night. But that is just a minor thing. I felt so comfortable and did have good sleeps on a wide bed. And yes, there is only cash payment for each night. Besides, there was another wonderful thing, that is the breakfast. I'm a Buddhist, so, I love the vegetarian breakfast here so much. The location is also great, too. As just about 3 minutes walk, I can reach Bugis MRT station. Love the hotel, definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: WinnyThePooh
Reviews.Content: Stay here for 1 night only. Make a reservation through the internet, the price is cheap for a good location. Room a bit small and dimly lit, old tv, old ac but the bathroom is clean and well sized. Pay in cash only, near the Bugis MRT. At night many food hawkers not far from the hotel.
