Its is what u pay for a budget hotel, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel in Good location”
Reviews.Author: pinoynotinpinas
Reviews.Content: To begin with, Singapore is not an inexpensive place to go on a vacation or to live in. At $80-90 SGD a night, this hotel is about the best deal that you can find in Singapore. You do get what you pay for. I stayed in this hotel on two occasions on my vacation. I was disappointed the first time I stayed in this hotel. I had a corner room that was dimly lit. The sink is located outside the bathroom. It was a little bit further than an arm distance. The shower was literally in front of the toilet. As soon as you cross over the door in the bathroom, the shower head was at the wall. The whole space including the toilet was less than 4x4 feet. When I came back to Singapore for the second leg of my vacation, most of the hotels in Singapore were booked. I was still fortunate that this hotel had vacancy. The room that we stayed in was the Superior room $90 SGD. The room was larger and the sink was in the bathroom. The bathroom was a lot larger than the last time, but still no tub or separation of the toilet from the shower. The room was still dim. I must admit though that the beds I slept in this hotel were very comfortable. They were firm and did not feel old. The hotel is located near Bugis MRT station. Less than a 5 minute walk. Lots of place to eat and close to Bugis Junction Mall. However, this is not the hotel for you if you want to sleep in. By 9 am, you can hear music and vendors outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good location budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nadine_Perth
Reviews.Content: We read the review on trip advisor before booking and thought we'd give it a go. Since they accept cash on a daily basis it was a low risk option. Below is what we found: 1. Location location - this place is excellent close to MRT'S, Little india, hawkers stores and shopping centres. There are two temples near to the hotel and every morning as you step out there is an abundance of colour as the local flower stores set up. It is located in the arts district so there is shows/ event continuously happening. 2. Price - we paid sing 80.00 a night - great for budget traveller 3. Room was tidy and bathroom was very clean, a/c worked. 4. There was construction next door, but this only started after 9.00 am and was stopped before evening..so there was no noise in the nights. 5. Breakfast - it is Singapore so the breakfast caters to the locals. Both my husband and I enjoyed the breakfast- there were 4 dishes - fried tofu or Singapore cakes, Singapore noodles, steamed rice buns with assorted filling and then a rice soup which was changed to fried rice on some days and coffee or tea. It was enjoyable change to usual toast or cereal. 6. Staff were always helpful and friendly 7. You pay cash per day, however we paid upfront for the week. The owners where very cautious to accept the week payment and made it clear that there was no refund should we change our mind. By the 2nd day we had decided that we'd definitely be staying the duration. We were pleasantly surprised and would visit again. Nadine, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Better than what I expected. Great hotel for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: mamen7
Reviews.Content: I came to Singapore the second time this year. The first time, I did not stay in this hotel but stayed in some hotels else such as Keong Saik, 1929 and Strand. This time, again, I followed the reviews in TripAdvisor to choose my accommodation for 8 days time in Singapore. My God, I couldn't understand why all the hotel raised their rates up to more 20 - 40% this period. Such as Bencoolen Hotel, they charged me 176 SGD per night for 2 persons. Thing was the same for some hotels else which I contacted after refusing to stay at Bencoolen. Thanks God, Keong Saik still kept their rates at an acceptable number, which was 90 SGD for a single one. However, the room was so small and I did not feel much comfortable. That's why I just stayed there only 1 night and tried to find another hotel with more reasonable rate. I was so surprised that when almost hotel in Singapore raised their rate this period, South East Asia still had the rate exactly as what they informed in their official site. So, I decided to stay there in 6 nights. Because I hadn't made any reservation before, I had to transfer room after each night. But it was not a serious problem, I was still happy to stay there with the cost of 80 SGD per night for a standard room and 90 SGD for superior room (same price for 1 and 2 persons). Moreover, I had the chance to discover some kinds of their room. For standaed room, it's really big if we consider it with some other budget hotels. Bathroom is also big enough without a bath-tub and is definitely clear. The annoyance is that they did not have mini-bar inside the room. Luckily, I didn't intend to use mini-bar so it didn't matter after all. Superior room is better, it's bigger and do have a mini-bar inside the room. There were not much noise at night, I spent all my nights there quietly and did have some good dreams. And guess what? You do not need to worry about your breakfast when staying South East Asia hotel 'coz they offer breakfast every morning, but it's all vegetarian food including rice, noodle and dumpling. Yeah, they do have a vegetarian restaurant there, too. If you wanna try a dish, I suggest "sweet and sour fried fish", it's absolutely delicious. Furthermore, the staffs are very friendly and useful. However, there were some annoyances that I can list as below. _ First, you can't bring room key along with you whenever you travel outside the hotel. You are suggested leaving them to the staffs and then, asking them whenever you return. _ Second, South East Asia hotel only accept the cash-only method of payment, they don't allow guests pay by their credit card or cheque or some thing like that. And you MUST pay daily, I mean, each night, you'll be asked to pay for your staying that night. It's all about the facilities and staff. Now, I'd like to mention about the location. SEA hotel locate in a pretty great location. Just 3 minutes walk, you can reach Bugis MRT station (East West line), or you can walk for about 5-7 minutes to reach Dhoby Ghaut MRT station connecting both North-South line and North-East line. There's also a food center just opposite to the hotel, but it's not very clean. And well, the biggest street shopping with many cheap price stuffs is right at the area, too. In conclusion, in my next travel to Singapore, I'll surely stay with SEA hotel again. My girlfriend also agrees that she'll advice her parents and friends to stay there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good loaction, bad breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Robje
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine, location is oke. Rooms are clean but a bit smelly. Service is okay. But the breakfast is awful, only rice every morning nothing else. Employees are friendly. It's a cheap hotel, so taking this into account, this hotel is great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: zebliz
Reviews.Content: Wondered whether booking a budget hotel in Singapore was a wise idea, but as soon as we arrived we knew it was a good decision. Although we had not paid a deposit, the room was held for us until we arrived at 11 pm, and the friendly receptionist was extremely helpful. The room was spotlessly clean and the only drawback was a rather noisy airconditioner, but otherwise everything was fine. The Chinese style breakfast was a bit of a shock to our Australian tastes, but after all, that's why you visit other cultures, to experience something new. If I had wanted Vegemite on toast I could have just stayed at home. Walking out the front door in the morning and finding a street full of colourful flower stalls and two large temples in the same block was just amazing. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: neehyan
Reviews.Content: Hmm...First of all I am from Malaysia and I personally call up the Hotel to make the book for 9th Aug 07 till 12th Aug and I did the room reservation confirmation by email as well. All calls and reservations was done promptly and email was replied fast as well with extra info such as how to go to the hotel by Taxi or the MRT. My personal experience is that the hotel is very convenient as it is very close to Bugis MRT station (3 minutes walk) and near to a Chinese food court which the food is selling cheap and nice and variety as well for local. Beside that the Bugis Street is a great place for cheap market shopping on cloths, fruits, souvenirs and many more. Ok back to the hotel, the AC is working fine even some other traveler complaint old and need replacement (I personally hard to adjust the temp and also the fan level as the AC is placed high up in the wall). Please bear in mind that this is a budget hotel and if the AC is working fine that would be good enough for me. The room is clean and the toilet is small but clean. Regarding the construction site beside the hotel is unavoidable as this is totally out hotel management control, I just close the window and the noise had reduced to my acceptable level. The constructions activities only happen during daytime so don’t worry at night as you will have peaceful sleep. The room rate for my Double Bed standard room is 80 SGD with simple breakfast which is value for money especially in Singapore there is no such thing as cheap and nice hotels. Regarding the breakfast, it really complimentary so doesn’t expect American style buffet breakfast. They basically provide a simple Chinese vegetarians fried noodle, fried rice and some buns or some bread toast with orange juice or coffee. If the breakfast portion does not satisfied you or you don’t like the food you can always go to near by MC Donald. As an overall, this Hotel is worth the money you paid for especially in Singapore and with the clean room and good service at the counter and convenient location, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone which is on budget trip. One of the down sides is the Hotel only accept cash payment and don't accept credit card. So please prepare extra cash. Thanks & Regards, Nee Hyan

Reviews.Title: “Its gr8 for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: SerendipityIndia
Reviews.Content: This is a gr8 hotel for budget travellers and is located at a nice location. Jus a 5 minutes walk to the Bugis MRT. Bugis Street - The largest street shopping in Singapore is located jus 2 min away from the hotel. You can get variety of things there. Also many good food outlets like KFC, McDonalds, Burger King are available nearby. There are also various shopping malls around. The hotel also houses Kwan Im Veg Restaurant. The food is not that good. I only had the toasts. The rooms are great. No problems watsoever. The management and customer care is also good. Online booking facility is fine. I'd really love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “simple, clean, secure”
Reviews.Author: neverwinter
Reviews.Content: For eighty pounds for three nights for two people in an excellent location in Bugis, obviously this hotel is not luxurious - but it is perfectly adequate. We stayed in a 'standard' room on the 4th floor (I asked to be high up) which was cleaned daily and included kettle, tea, coffee and cups, tv, large wardrobe, chair, desk, bedside tables. The attached bathroom is just big enough for a toilet and a hand held shower, but the water is hot and good pressure, and the fan and room aircon dry things out quickly. There is a separate sink in the room. Aircon didn't seem controllable and the only way to turn it off was to remove the key from the room power socket, obviously losing everything else. Didn't bother me but my husband got cold. Included breakfast is Chinese style and its my fault that I can't cope with chopsticks in the morning, but there are plenty of nearby alternatives. Staff were very helpful, friendly and security conscious; as we checked in someone was stopped and told not to go up to her friend's room, but to wait for her friend to come down. The hotel entrance is on a pedestrianised area so despite nearby temples, street markets etc it is surprisingly quiet. would stay again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Just enough....”
Reviews.Author: Ethel_Travels
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel in Sept 11-13,2005 After internet searching, I chose this hotel because I have found out that its rate is fair.. to think that the location is near the Bugis station... very accessible! (Thumbs up!) However, during the first night, I had experienced some bed bugs bite and my husband on the second...I didnt get some on the 2nd night coz I rolled up myself in the blanket...enough to hide myself from bugs and have a good sleep... In overall rating, the location is very good... very accessible because its at the city center... we have travelled the nearby places just by walking even at midnight....

Reviews.Title: “I keep returning”
Reviews.Author: pat-pal
Reviews.Content: doubt you could do better for the price. clean, centrally located, satellite TV. why pay more? located next door to a chinese temple, and two doors down from an indian temple means the street in front is always full of interesting sights. note: the free breakfasts are hardly appetizing.

HotelInfo.Name: South East Asia Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 190 Waterloo St, Singapore 187965, Singapore
